known_issues.title: Lack of Automated Salary Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: Current system cannot automatically calculate salary based on actual working days, requiring manual interventions and separate tracking.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The current Bayzat payroll system lacks automated salary calculation based on precise working days. The platform cannot dynamically adjust salaries proportionally when employees work more or fewer than the standard 26 working days.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a significant product gap in automated, attendance-driven salary calculation. The system currently requires manual tracking of overtime, unpaid leaves, and does not support automatic pro-rata salary adjustments per employee.

known_issues.title: Payroll Settings Override Leave Policy Formula
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator in payroll settings intentionally overrides the formula configured in leave policy for unpaid leave. The leave policy formula appears greyed out, indicating it is not active. This creates user confusion about which formula is actually being applied for daily wage calculations.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Payroll settings daily wage calculator takes precedence over leave policy formula for unpaid leave calculations.
known_issues.gap_statement: No synchronized mechanism exists for daily wage formula configuration between leave policy and payroll modules.

known_issues.title: Incorrect Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: System failed to recalculate pending unpaid leave deductions when new salary configurations were created after leave request submission. Deductions were calculated based on outdated salary configurations instead of the most recent salary setup, resulting in incorrect payroll deductions.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform could not automatically recalculate pending unpaid leave deductions when new salary configurations were created after leave request submission.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a product gap in dynamic salary configuration handling, specifically in automatically updating pending leave deductions when salary configurations change.

known_issues.title: End of Service Gratuity Leap Year Miscalculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system incorrectly calculates service days by using 365 days instead of 366 days for leap years (specifically 2024), resulting in an inaccurate gratuity calculation. This leads to a lower gratuity amount for employees with service spanning leap years.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Gratuity calculation logic does not automatically adjust for leap years, causing inaccurate service period calculations.
known_issues.gap_statement: The EOS gratuity calculator requires enhancement to dynamically handle leap year calculations and automatically recognize 366-day years in service period computations.

known_issues.title: End of Service Pro-Rated Amount Calculation Error
known_issues.issue_explanation: End of Service (EOS) calculation is producing incorrect pro-rated amounts due to a rounding or decimal precision error. The daily wage formula (basic + allowances / 30) is configured correctly, but when calculating pro-rated EOS amounts, the system consistently shows amounts that are less than expected by 0.1 or 0.2 decimals.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform's current daily wage calculation engine has a decimal precision limitation that causes systematic undercalculation of pro-rated amounts.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a potential product gap in the precision of financial calculations, specifically in pro-rated salary computations.

known_issues.title: EOS Gratuity Calculation Variance
known_issues.issue_explanation: System gratuity calculation showed slight difference from manual calculation (AED 231,821 vs AED 252,485). Detailed calculation breakdown revealed system uses specific service duration and daily wage formula with tiered rates (21 days per year for first 5 years, 30 days per year after 5 years).
known_issues.limitation_statement: Potential minor calculation differences between system and manual calculations
known_issues.gap_statement: Calculation method may require additional transparency or reconciliation mechanism

known_issues.title: Gratuity Calculation Discrepancy in Leap Year
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system's gratuity calculation may not consistently handle leap year days (February 29th), causing minor discrepancies in total service days and resulting gratuity amount. The difference was observed between manual calculation (913 days) and system calculation (912 days), leading to a slight variation in gratuity amount from AED 14,708.05 to AED 14,691.95.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leap year day inclusion in service duration calculation is not transparently handled
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for clear documentation on how leap year days are counted in service duration calculations

known_issues.title: Gratuity Calculation Methodology Nuances
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator's gratuity calculation involves complex logic for handling partial years of service, especially for periods above 5 years. The system calculates service duration differently from manual expectations, using specific approaches for leap years and incomplete service periods.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform's gratuity calculation logic is complex and not transparently communicated, potentially leading to misunderstandings about calculation methodology.
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for more detailed, user-friendly explanation of gratuity calculation logic, including worked examples of service duration calculation for partial years and leap year handling.

known_issues.title: Discrepancy in Days Worked Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: System calculates total job tenure with a potential extra day (622 vs 623 days), which impacts gratuity calculation precision
known_issues.limitation_statement: Minor discrepancy in days worked counting method

known_issues.title: Fixed Daily Wage Divisor Limitation
known_issues.issue_explanation: Platform uses a hardcoded daily wage calculation of (Basic Salary / 30), which differs from some client expectations of (Basic Salary × 12 / 365)
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculation uses a fixed 30-day divisor that cannot be modified
known_issues.gap_statement: The platform lacks flexibility in daily wage computation methods

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Accrual Calculation Inconsistency
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator's 'working days' setting causes monthly fluctuations in leave salary accrual calculations. The daily wage rate changes based on the number of working days in each month, leading to inconsistent cumulative totals.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculations vary monthly due to different working day counts
known_issues.gap_statement: The platform lacks a straightforward way to maintain consistent daily wage calculations across months

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Proration Calculation Discrepancy
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system calculates leave salary and salary proration using independent daily wage configurations with different divisors (30 vs 30.42 days), causing calculation mismatches. This means the leave salary calculation does not match the client's expected proration formula of (Basic salary + allowances / 30.42 days).
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leave salary and salary proration use separate daily wage configurations that cannot be automatically aligned without manual configuration.
known_issues.gap_statement: No unified daily wage calculation method exists that consistently applies across leave salary and salary proration scenarios.

known_issues.title: Proration Calculation Confusion
known_issues.issue_explanation: User initially misunderstood how working days are calculated based on work week configuration. The system was actually calculating correctly, with the specific work week (NVK Operations) having all 7 days configured as working days.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Proration depends entirely on work week configuration, which can include all 7 days as working days

known_issues.title: Incorrect Salary Proration for Offboarded Employees
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system fails to correctly prorate salaries when an employee's departure date is in the future relative to payroll processing date. When an employee is offboarded (e.g., on Nov 28th) and payroll is processed earlier (e.g., on Nov 27th), the system displays the full monthly salary instead of prorating it.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Payroll system lacks robust date-sensitive proration logic for employees with future departure dates
known_issues.gap_statement: Product gap in daily wage calculator's ability to handle dynamic proration scenarios, especially for employees with departure dates differing from payroll processing date

known_issues.title: Persistent Payroll Deductions After Leave Request Deletion
known_issues.issue_explanation: When an unpaid leave request is approved and transaction submitted, then the daily wage calculation is changed and the transaction deleted to recalculate, the system creates duplicate deductions—one with the old calculation and one with the new. Deleting the leave request does not remove associated payroll deductions.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform lacks robust synchronization logic between leave management and payroll deduction systems. When leave transactions are modified or deleted, payroll deduction module does not automatically reconcile or remove associated deductions.
known_issues.gap_statement: Clear product gap in leave-to-payroll transaction management, specifically around handling recalculations, deletions, and status changes of leave requests without creating orphaned or duplicate deductions.

known_issues.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation Inconsistency
known_issues.issue_explanation: When public holidays are added after a leave request is created, the daily wage calculation becomes misaligned between Payroll and Time Off modules, resulting in incorrect salary deduction amounts. The system cannot retroactively recalculate deductions when configuration changes occur mid-cycle.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The Bayzat platform lacks real-time synchronization between Time Off and Payroll modules, preventing automatic recalculation when public holidays are added after leave requests.
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for enhanced module communication to ensure accurate working days calculation and consistent salary deduction across system configurations.

known_issues.title: Unpredictable Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculations
known_issues.issue_explanation: The payroll system uses a custom daily wage divisor (30.42 days) instead of calendar days, which can produce deduction amounts that differ from user expectations, potentially causing confusion about calculation methods.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculated using 30.42 days divisor, not calendar days
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparent explanation for complex payroll calculation methods, especially for leave deductions that might exceed expected monthly salary amounts

known_issues.title: Incorrect Days Display in Unpaid Leave Remarks
known_issues.issue_explanation: The platform displays incorrect remarks for daily wage calculations in February, showing 31 days instead of the actual 29 days for leap years. The backend calculation remains accurate, but the frontend display creates potential user confusion.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform currently displays incorrect remarks for daily wage calculations in February, showing 31 days instead of the actual 29 days for leap years. While the backend calculation remains accurate, the frontend display creates potential user confusion.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a need for a dynamic calendar days detection mechanism that automatically adjusts daily rate calculations and remarks based on the actual number of days in each month, especially for edge cases like February in leap years.

known_issues.title: Global Daily Rate Configuration Overrides Policy Settings
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system applies a global daily rate configuration that supersedes individual leave policy settings for unpaid leave calculations. This results in deductions being calculated using a system-wide method instead of policy-specific calculations.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Global daily rate settings automatically override policy-specific unpaid leave calculation methods
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparency in configuration hierarchy and limited user controls for customizing leave deduction calculations

known_issues.title: Unpaid Leave Daily Rate Incorrectly Displayed
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system shows the daily rate from the payroll month (May) instead of the leave occurrence month (April), causing user confusion. The actual deduction amount is calculated correctly, but the displayed daily rate is from the wrong month.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily rate display does not reflect the leave occurrence month's rate
known_issues.gap_statement: Need a consistent daily rate display mechanism that preserves the initially calculated rate at leave request time

limitations.title: Fixed 26 Working Days Monthly Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: Salary is based on a standard 26 working days per month, calculated from 365 annual days minus 52 weekly offs, resulting in 313 working days per year divided by 12 months.
limitations.impact: Requires manual adjustments for employees working more or fewer than 26 days

limitations.title: Inconsistent Formula Configuration Across Modules
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage formula can be configured differently in leave policy and payroll settings, with payroll settings taking precedence.
limitations.impact: Users may be confused by greyed-out formulas and unexpected calculation differences

limitations.title: Salary Config Creation Impacts Deduction Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: Unpaid leave deduction calculations depend on the timing of salary configuration creation relative to leave request submission.
limitations.impact: Potential incorrect payroll deductions if salary configuration is not created before or updated with leave request

limitations.title: Incorrect Leap Year Day Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: System defaults to 365 days for all years, failing to recognize leap years with 366 days in service period calculations.
limitations.impact: Potential underpayment of employee end of service gratuity benefits

limitations.title: Decimal Precision in Pro-Rated Calculations
limitations.limitation_statement: Pro-rated amount calculations consistently produce results that are slightly less than expected due to decimal handling issues.
limitations.impact: Potential financial discrepancies in end of service settlements

limitations.title: Mid-Month Departure Leave Accrual Limitation
limitations.limitation_statement: Leave days are only accrued at end of month under monthly accrual policy, preventing prorated leave inclusion for mid-month departures
limitations.impact: Employees departing mid-month cannot automatically include current month's leave balance in End of Service settlement

limitations.title: Service Duration Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: Unclear methodology for counting service days, including whether the departure date is considered a working day and how leap year days are integrated

limitations.title: Non-Configurable Daily Wage Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage is calculated using a fixed 30-day divisor that cannot be modified via configuration
limitations.impact: Prevents customization of daily wage calculation for different organizational requirements

limitations.title: Working Days Impact on Daily Wage
limitations.limitation_statement: Leave encashment calculations are based on working days, which can vary month to month (e.g., February having 20 working days)
limitations.impact: Cumulative leave salary accruals will differ across months due to varying working day counts

limitations.title: Separate Calculation Methods for Leave and Proration
limitations.limitation_statement: The system calculates leave salary and salary proration using independent daily wage configurations with different divisors.
limitations.impact: Potential inconsistent salary calculations and manual configuration required to align calculation methods

limitations.title: Daily Wage Proration Based on Work Week
limitations.limitation_statement: Salary proration is calculated based on the specific work week configuration, which may include all days as working days
limitations.impact: Proration will reflect the configured work week, even if this means counting all 31 days as working days

limitations.title: Inconsistent Salary Proration Based on Departure Date
limitations.limitation_statement: Salary proration only works correctly when departure date is in the past; fails for future departure dates
limitations.impact: Potential incorrect salary calculations for employees with future offboarding dates

limitations.title: Incomplete Leave Transaction Deletion Handling
limitations.limitation_statement: Deleting or modifying leave transactions does not properly update associated payroll deductions, leading to persistent incorrect deductions.
limitations.impact: Users cannot reliably recalculate or remove unpaid leave deductions through standard transaction management processes.

limitations.title: Working Days Calculation Methodology
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage is calculated as: (basic salary + allowance) / working days, where working days exclude weekends and public holidays specific to the employee's country of residence.
limitations.impact: Salary deductions for unpaid leave depend on precise working days calculation, which can be affected by public holiday configurations.

limitations.title: Non-Standard Daily Wage Divisor
limitations.limitation_statement: System uses 30.42 days as divisor for daily wage calculation, not standard calendar days
limitations.impact: Deduction amounts may not precisely match expected monthly salary

limitations.title: Month-Specific Daily Rate Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculations are based on the actual calendar days in a month, with specific handling for months with different day counts (e.g., February in leap years).
limitations.impact: Ensures accurate unpaid leave deductions by using the precise number of days in each month

limitations.title: System-Wide Settings Override Policy Configurations
limitations.limitation_statement: The platform has a global configuration that supersedes individual policy-level settings for unpaid leave calculations
limitations.impact: Users cannot customize leave deduction calculations at the policy level when a global setting exists

limitations.title: Daily Rate Calculation Method
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily rate is calculated as (Basic + Allowances) / Working Days, excluding public holidays
limitations.impact: Affects unpaid leave deduction calculations across different months
